text: Robert "Bud" Templeton Hamilton (11 November 1903 – 7 February 1964) was an Irish professional footballer. Hamilton started his career with his hometown club, Newry Town. He then moved to Scotland with Rangers, where he was a member of their 1929–30 'clean-sweep' team which claimed the Scottish Football League championship, Scottish Cup, Glasgow Cup and Charity Cup.(Rangers player) Hamilton, Robert, FitbaStats He had already won the double in 1927–28 and the league title in 1928–29 (losing in the 1929 Scottish Cup Final), and claimed one further championship medal in 1930–31. He left Ibrox in February 1933 to sign for English Division Two side, Bradford City. In two seasons at Valley Parade he made 26 appearances before moving north of the border again to join Third Lanark (taking part in the 1936 Scottish Cup Final, a defeat to former employers Rangers),Rangers Retain Scottish Cup, The Glasgow Herald, 20 April 1936 and later moved to Morton before returning to Northern Ireland with Bangor.Bob Hamilton, Northern Ireland's Footballing Greats, 16 December 2006; accessed 6 May 2014 Whilst with Rangers, Hamilton added five Ireland caps to the Inter-League honour he had won while with Newry Town just before moving to Glasgow. He tasted victory just once, on his debut against Scotland in February 1928. ==References== Category:1903 births Category:1964 deaths Category:Sportspeople from Newry Category:Association footballers from Northern Ireland Category:Newry City F.C. players Category:Bangor F.C. players Category:Rangers F.C. players Category:Bradford City A.F.C. players Category:Third Lanark A.C. players Category:NIFL Premiership players Category:Scottish Football League players Category:English Football League players Category:Irish League representative players Category:Greenock Morton F.C. players Category:Pre-1950 IFA international footballers Category:Association football defenders Category:Disease-related deaths in Wales
